content:
The chunk contains additional details about several libraries and tools related to Panda3D, including OpenAL Soft, Cg Toolkit, Eigen, and libsquish, along with their respective licenses and notes on usage. These entries are situated within the broader document that discusses various libraries, dependencies, and tools required for different functionalities in Panda3D, such as audio support, shader generation, linear algebra optimization, and image compression.

```context
The chunk is part of a section discussing additional libraries and tools used by Panda3D, including OpenAL Soft for audio support, the Cg Toolkit for shader generation, Eigen for linear algebra optimizations, and libsquish for image compression. Each entry provides licensing information and usage notes to help developers understand their roles within the Panda3D ecosystem.
```

License: GNU LGPL

OpenAL Soft

https://openal-soft.org

The Open Audio Library is a free alternative to FMOD and supports nearly the same features, including 3D surround sound. We ship the OpenAL Soft implementation by default on Windows. It can be easily removed from the distribution.

License: LGPL

Cg Toolkit

https://developer.nvidia.com/cg-toolkit

Nvidia's Cg Toolkit is required for Panda's Cg support. At the moment, it cannot be removed without recompiling Panda3D from source code.

License: Proprietary

License note: Required to use the Panda3D Shader Generator, which utilizes Nvidia Cg.

Eigen

http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/

Optimized linear algebra library. Optional, but improves performance of matrix operations significantly.

License: MPL2

libsquish

https://code.google.com/archive/p/libsquish/
